content:
edit_custom_type_field.gif edit_choices_type_field.gif

Alya Abbott Should I change the delete buttons for choices field types, as they were before?
They are currently looking like these because of modal's CSS.
delete_button.png
Yeah, that looks unnecessarily red and scary. :) Let's change those buttons back to how they look now. Thanks for checking!

edit_choices_profile_field_type.png

I think it is looking fine now, right?

I think it's better.
If you want to try just a dark grey icon, which shows rectangle only on hover I think that would be even better
On hover, the color will still be dark grey?
In settings > custom profile fields, all delete buttons are like this in edit_choices_profile_field_type.png.

This is how it will look.
on_hover_border.gif

That seems reasonable, but I think if we're adding a new styling option, we should think about consistency / its intended scope.

Is the idea that removing something while you are creating an object (and haven't finalized it) is a less "serious" action, and should not have red associated with it? If so, should the "Remove" buttons for users being added to a stream be grey rather than red?

Screen-Shot-2022-04-04-at-11.56.16-AM.png
We should also make sure we have a plan for dark theme.
Alya Abbott For now should we go with the red button as shown in edit_choices_profile_field_type.png?

Add a new custom profile field form in the modal.
custom_profile_fields.png working.gif
Isn't the modal form should be saved on the press of enter key, currently happens nothing, I also tried with other modals in settings.
@Alya Abbott are you satisfied with these changes as shown in the above screenshots for the "Add a new custom profile field" form into modal.
Yeah, the screen shot / screen capture looks good to me -- thanks! It should help clear up a lot of weirdness with edge cases in that UI.

Yogesh Sirsat said:

Isn't the modal form should be saved on the press of enter key, currently happens nothing, I also tried with other modals in settings.

I think probably that'd be helpful for some modals but not others; we can think about that as a follow-up.

Alya Abbott said:

It should help clear up a lot of weirdness with edge cases in that UI.

Would you like to see screenshots of the other field types too or test it using PR?
As long as you've tested it and think it looks reasonable with all field types, I can just play with it in the PR -- thanks!
What about delete buttons in modal, should I go with red or black?

Yogesh Sirsat said:

What about delete buttons in modal, should I go with red or black?

Black makes sense to me; I'll file an issue to update the stream creation UI as well.
Filed #21863 for the stream creation UI.

This is how the delete buttons will look, I tried to make them look like the cancel button from modals.
delete_button_inside_modal.gif

This is the last check I guess, after this, I am going to post PR.
@Yogesh Sirsat yeah, that lgtm.
PR posted here #21878.

While editing the custom profile field, we display an input box for the field type of the external account type profile field(even though we can't edit it) but not for other custom profile fields, is it okay, or should we make a change here?
custom_profile_field_external_account_type.png
Could we make that label and hint editable? It seems very reasonable to allow admins to tweak them.

Yeah, we can make them editable, for that, we could have to make changes in both frontend and backend code

One update I would like to give here is the label and hint field of the default external account type was meant to be hidden, there was a typo in code from one of the previous commits, currently, I fixed it in this commit as a part of this current topics PR.

Got it, I see. Those fields are hidden when the field is being created, so it makes some sense that they'd be hidden at editing time as well. At least, that fixes the buggy experience where it incorrectly looks like you can edit them.
I'm happy with making the tactical fix of hiding them, and filing an issue for later to actually make them editable.
Would you be up for filing that issue Yogesh Sirsat ?
Yeah, sure.
If needed here is the issue.

Are the label and hint really not editable? We appear to have chosen non-default values for them here on CZO:
image.png
The values we have here are better than the defaults, too -- it'd be a good change to just make those be the defaults.
They aren't through the UI, at least.
Screen-Shot-2022-06-24-at-11.53.10-AM.png
Weird.

custom_profile_fields: Make "Name" and "Hint" field of default "External account" type profile fields editable. #22371

PR posted.
@Yogesh Sirsat I've tagged #21878 to merge once CI passes, but there's a follow-up I think we need to do.

Specifically, when we change options for a select field, the a saving..saved loading spinner experience happens in the modal, but it's too quick to see. This contrasts with, for example, deleting a custom profile field or reordering them, which shows our standard saving...saved organization settings experience. I propose the following changes from testing this:

  • We add a success_continuation when closing these modals after a successful change to show the "Saved!" notice on the main settings page, for consistency.
  • We change the "delete a custom profile field" button to have a confirmation modal showing how many users have set that field, just like we added recently for removing an option for the select field type, rather than just immediately executing the deletion.
  • I noticed the modal to confirm deleting an option from a select type custom profile field doesn't tell you which option(s) you removed; maybe it could be extended to address that?

The missing leading / here on /help/add-... is a bug; probably one we need a linter for.
This is one right?
@Yogesh Sirsat I'm not sure I understand the question.

This is more of a #frontend thing, but it looks like we have one current instance of an incorrect link that such a lint rule would catch:

$ git grep '"help/' templates/ static/templates/
static/templates/search_operators.hbs:            <a href="help/search-for-messages#search-operators" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer">{{t "Detailed search operators documentation" }}</a>

Tim Abbott said:

Yogesh Sirsat I'm not sure I understand the question.

Ohh Sorry, I replied directly from mentions I didn't see the text below of that message,
Tim Abbott said:

Yogesh Sirsat I've tagged #21878 to merge once CI passes, but there's a follow-up I think we need to do.

I should have quoted and replied like this because I thought this comment on PR is a follow-up after #21878.

Tim Abbott said:

Specifically, when we change options for a select field, the a saving..saved loading spinner experience happens in the modal, but it's too quick to see. This contrasts with, for example, deleting a custom profile field or reordering them, which shows our standard saving...saved organization settings experience. I propose the following changes from testing this:

  • We add a success_continuation when closing these modals after a successful change to show the "Saved!" notice on the main settings page, for consistency.
  • We change the "delete a custom profile field" button to have a confirmation modal showing how many users have set that field, just like we added recently for removing an option for the select field type, rather than just immediately executing the deletion.
  • I noticed the modal to confirm deleting an option from a select type custom profile field doesn't tell you which option(s) you removed; maybe it could be extended to address that?

Interesting work, should I open issues for this first or just start working on PRs?
Issues are helpful for anything that we might lose track of, but not necessarily if something seems like it will be a relatively simple PR that we should be able to get merged quickly.
You can judge better than me where these things fall. :)

@Yogesh Sirsat yeah, I would personally just try to do a PR for it with one commit for each detail, since it seems like the kind of thing one could do pretty quickly; it's best to prioritize this sort of thing so we don't lose track of it.
What text should we use for the "delete a custom profile field" confirmation modal submit button, Delete or Confirm?

Hmm, I guess we haven't entirely settled the discussion in #design > Confirmation modal of "Deactivate" bot.

At least for now, "Confirm" would be consistent with deleting groups, so maybe we should go with that?

Screen-Shot-2022-08-29-at-4.17.11-PM.png
PR posted #22818
Cool, I can take a look once Ganesh Pawar (ganpa3) has had a chance to review.
